required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Investigation of the Relationship Between Sensory Processing and Kinesychophobia in Fibromyalgia Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Investigation of the Relationship Between Sensory Processing and Kinesychophobia in

brief_summary.textblock: Fibromyalgia; is a chronic and rheumatic condition characterized by diffuse pain. In patients with fibromyalgia syndrome, there is an increase in psychiatric symptoms, especially depression, anxiety, and somatoform disorders. Kinesophobia is defined as anxiety against pain and pain caused by painful injury and re-injury. The aim of this study was to investigate the relationship between kinesophobia and sensory processing in patients with fibromyalgia.

detailed_description.textblock: Fibromyalgia; is a chronic and rheumatic condition characterized by diffuse pain. In patients with fibromyalgia syndrome, there is an increase in psychiatric symptoms, especially depression, anxiety, and somatoform disorders. Kinesophobia is defined as anxiety against pain and pain caused by painful injury and re-injury. The aim of this study was to investigate the relationship between kinesophobia and sensory processing in patients with fibromyalgia.

primary_outcome.measure: Sensory processing assessed with the Sensory Adolescent / Adult Sensory Profile Questionnaire
primary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of the third month
primary_outcome.description: Sensory processing disorder refers to the difficulty of processing the information coming from the sensory organs, and the inefficiency of the normal sensory processing process.For the evaluation of sensory processing; Sensory Adolescent / Adult Sensory Profile questionnaire will be used.

primary_outcome.measure: Knesychophobia assessed with the Tampa Kineshiophobia Scale
primary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of the third month
primary_outcome.description: Kinezyophobia is defined as anxiety against pain and pain caused by painful injury and re-injury. For the evaluation of kinesiophobia; Tampa Kineshiophobia Scale will be used.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18-65 years old
- Diagnosed by fibromyalgia
- No other known physical, neurological and psychological illness
- Literate
- Volunteers to participate in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not compliant with inclusion criteria
